Tridi — Basic usage

Basic Tridi viewer with minimum configuration. Supports mouse dragging and touch events. Loads all images immediately.

In this configuration Tridi assumes images are named by non-padded numbers from 1 to n (e.g. 1.png, 2.png etc.) and located in imageLocation.

Properties passed to options are case-sensitive. E.g. if you pass 'png' as imageFormat, Tridi will try to load 1.png and not 1.PNG. On Windows, which is case-insensitive by design, this is particularly important.

Code

HTML

<div id="tridi-basic"></div>

JavaScript

new Tridi({
  element: '#tridi-basic',
  imageLocation: './path/to/image/folder',
  imageFormat: 'jpg',
  imageCount: 36,
}).load();

See API documentation for all available options or CSS styling for a minimum viable stylesheet.
